alert.note: Alert for Brooks; Coastal Cameron; Coastal Kenedy; Coastal Willacy; Inland Cameron; Inland Kenedy; Inland Willacy; Jim Hogg; Northern Hidalgo; Southern Hidalgo; Starr; Zapata (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 30 at 5:03PM CDT until March 30 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...CRITICAL TO LOCALLY EXTREME FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS CONTINUING THROUGH 7 OR 8 PM... .As of 5 PM...several wildfires were observed by satellite and confirmed by crews on the ground. Two large wildfires with minimal containment were observed on the King Ranch in eastern Brooks and southeastern Kenedy County...with smaller fires in Hidalgo County near the South Texas International Airport 11 miles north of Edniburg, and along the Hidalgo/Starr County line near Sullivan City. Ranchers, farmers, and others are strongly urged to refrain from using any equipment that can spark a fire for the remainder of the afternooon and early evening. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WINDS, DRY FUELS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES FOR THE RIO GRANDE VALLEY AND DEEP SOUTH TEXAS RANCH AND BRUSH COUNTRY... * AFFECTED AREA...Zapata, Jim Hogg, Brooks, Inland Kenedy, Starr, Southern Hidalgo, Inland Willacy, Inland Cameron, Coastal Willacy, Coastal Cameron, Coastal Kenedy, and Northern Hidalgo Counties. * TIMING...Through 8 PM Wednesday. * WIND...Northwest 15 to 20 mph with a few gusts to 30 mph west of IH-69C and US 77. * HUMIDITY...Relative humidity values between 8 and 12 percent through 7 PM, then rising through the teens until 8 PM. Higher values east of IH-69E and US 77. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means critical fire weather conditions are occurring now...or will shortly. In general...these conditions include sustained 20 foot winds of 25 MPH or greater...humidity ranging from below 25 percent in Zapata County to below 45 percent along the coast...each lasting for 2 hours or longer... and cured fuels. Humidity below 25 percent in most areas will trigger fire danger at lower wind speeds. Detailed decision tables are found at HTTP://WEATHER.GOV/RGV/?N=MAPCOLORS#FIRE.
